poem:
Title: "In the Theater of Politics"

Money, a bruising tide
that decks the halls of discourse,
A hundred million voices, 
silent in the wallet's clasp.
Progressive roots dig – branches 
aim for sunlit dignity.
Yet beneath the sanguinary 
skies of Gaza, echo the cries.
A grand Game breeds bitter yield,
Colored green and red,
the seeds of discontent are sown,
In the furrows of an election year.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pro-Israel US groups plan $100m effort to unseat progressives over Gaza Pro-Israel groups are pumping millions into this year’s heated congressional races, singling out progressives who have voiced criticism of the Israeli government and its relentless campaign in Gaza. The American Israel Public Affairs Committee (Aipac) is betting that $100m will be enough to fight back a wave of progressive dissent over Israel’s war in Gaza this election cycle. After investing heavily in the 2022". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
